a.span: April 15, 2020 | New learning supports starting April 20

div.p: With distance learning being extended through the end of the school year, the district is putting into place new learning supports starting Monday, April 20. The goal is to provide a more predictable school day experience as your child(ren) continue to adjust to learning in a remote environment. Please click the headline for details.

a.title: Go to comments for April 15, 2020 | New learning supports starting April 20

img.alt: How well are we serving you?

a.span: How well are we serving you?

div.p: Our goal is to provide what you and your students need to make learning at home successful. Would you please take a few minutes to answer a short parent/guardian survey letting us know how we are doing and how we could do better? The survey is open now through midnight on Sunday, April 19. Your feedback is most welcome and appreciated. Click link for survey.

a.title: Go to comments for How well are we serving you?

div.p: If you have not had the chance to pick up a Chromebook for your student to engage in learning from home, please contact your school principal to arrange a time to get a Chromebook for your child. | Si no ha tenido la oportunidad de recoger un Chromebook para que su estudiante pueda aprender desde casa, comuníquese con el director de su escuela para programar un horario para obtener un Chromebook para su hijo.

a.title: Go to comments for April 13, 2020 | Family Tech Support Update

img.alt: Emergency meals served to all children ages 1-18 years

a.span: Emergency meals served to all children ages 1-18 years

div.p: Emergency meals served to all children ages 1-18 years. Click link for more information on locations and times.

a.title: Go to comments for Emergency meals served to all children ages 1-18 years

img.alt: schools closed through end of school year

a.span: School buildings closed through end of school year

div.p: On April 6, Governor Inslee announced the closure of all school buildings in our state through the end of this school year. Please click the headline for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for School buildings closed through end of school year
Subscribe to RSS Feed - District Announcements
a.span: Subscribe to RSS Feed - District Announcements

div.span: Schools closed March 16 – April 24. Stay informed and check this website for updates.

a.title: Go to comments for Schools closed March 16 – April 24.

span.p: We are incredibly proud of our dedicated staff! Check out what they have been up to ...

p.em: Inspire, educate, and prepare each student to achieve to high standards, contribute to our community, and thrive in a global society.

a.title: Find out all about Evereett Public Schools and the jobs available
